post.author: Rayne
post.body:
Incredible... I just discovered that 3DRealms did compiled an official wiki for Prey editing, with lots of infos and stuff that makes the Preditor a really cool program to work with... Here's the link

http://www.3drealms.com/prey/wiki/index.php/Main_Page


And some of the cool new features of Preditor:

Quote:
- Added new navigation modes to the 3d/camera view (UnrealEd-Style and FPS-style)


- Many additional commands can be bound to keyboard shortcuts.

Navigation mode features added:

* Teleport function. Instantly move close to the object the camera is pointing at. [details below]
* Quick select (left mouse button will select while nav-mode is active).
* Target lock. Focus the camera on an object and rotate about it. [details below]
* Camera view information displays. Quickly show information in the camera view about the entity or material that you're pointing at. [details below]
* Mouse-controlled texture adjustment (position, scale, rotation). [details below]


More stuff here

http://www.3drealms.com/prey/wiki/index ... of_Changes

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: Ah, I knew they had a wiki somewhere but I never bothered opening the mapeditor to get the link.
